page.title: 08Stetchworth Primary School
page.content: Stetchworth County Primary School was built by Lord Ellesmere in 1897.It is a small rural school with 49 children,2 full time teachers, Mr Tallack,the Headteacher,and Mrs Nickerson and 2 part time teachers. There are two classrooms and another room which is used as a library and dining room.There is also a kitchen although meals are no longer cooked on the premises.We still have outside toilets.Also outside is the playground and a grassed area with a swimming pool and climbing frame.The inside of the school has recently been redecorated and new lighting and power points have been installed. When children leave this school at 11,they normally transfer to Bottisham Village College.
